SEARCH

Class Room

java.lang.Object
Game
Room
public class Room extends Game
Class contains a Room. A new room object is made every time the player chooses a valid direction.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class Game

    console, exits, EXITS_FILE, OUTCOME_FILE

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Room()
    Default constructor which creates an object of class Room with no exits.

  • Constructor Details

    • Room

      public Room()
      Default constructor which creates an object of class Room with no exits.

  • Method Details

    • getNumExits

      public int getNumExits()
      Access method that returns the number of exits in the room. This is used to check if the room has no exits and the player has reached a dead-end.
      Returns:
      An integer that represents the number of exits in the room.

    • generateExits

      public void generateExits()
      This method generates the available exits and the valid directions.

    • displayExits

      public String displayExits()
      This method adds the available exits and associated probabilities to a string buffer and displays them to the player. The method also adds a graphic of the room to the stringbuffer depending on the available exits.
      Returns:
      A stringbuffer containing the available exits and a graphic.

    • getDirections

      public ArrayList<String> getDirections()
      Access method to retrieve the valid directions for the next room.
      Returns:
      ArrayList - containing the valid directional inputs.

    • checkDirections

      public boolean checkDirections(String input)
      This method checks if the input direction is valid.
      Parameters:
      input - - String, the direction the player chose to move in.
      Returns:
      boolean - true if the input direction is valid. false if the input direction is not valid.

    • checkExitPortal

      public boolean checkExitPortal(String direction)
      Method to check if the chosen direction leads to the escape portal.
      Parameters:
      direction - - String, the direction the player chose to move in.
      Returns:
      Boolean: true: player found the escape portal. false: The exit chosen was not the escape portal.

    • updateProbabilities

      public void updateProbabilities(String direction)
      This method updates the probabilities of exit and magic police for the chosen direction if the chosen direction did not lead to the escape portal.
      Parameters:
      direction - - A String of the direction the player chose to move in.

    • checkPolice

      public boolean checkPolice(String direction)
      This method checks if the room in the chosen direction triggers the magic police.
      Parameters:
      direction - - the direction the player chose to move in as a String.
      Returns:
      boolean - true: police appear, false: police don't appear.

    • policeAlarm

      public void policeAlarm()
      This method is called by the Magic Box class and triggers a magic police alarm if the magic box is opened.
